segment.source: MD Conversion - Mobile device security policy settings in Microsoft Intune
segment.target: MD Conversion - Mobile device security policy settings in Microsoft Intune

segment.source: MD Conversion - Mobile device security policy settings in Microsoft Intune
segment.target: MD Conversion - Mobile device security policy settings in Microsoft Intune

segment.source: now features separate configuration policies for each device platform, and these policies contain the most up-to-date settings you can use.
segment.target: now features separate configuration policies for each device platform, and these policies contain the most up-to-date settings you can use.

segment.source: You can continue to use the mobile device security policy and any existing deployments will still work.
segment.target: You can continue to use the mobile device security policy and any existing deployments will still work.

segment.source: However, you should plan to migrate to the new configuration policies as soon as possible as the mobile device security policy will be removed in the future.
segment.target: However, you should plan to migrate to the new configuration policies as soon as possible as the mobile device security policy will be removed in the future.

segment.source: Use mobile device security policies to configure a wide range of settings that you can deploy to managed devices in your organization.
segment.target: Use mobile device security policies to configure a wide range of settings that you can deploy to managed devices in your organization.

segment.source: These settings can be used to control the functionality and security of your devices.
segment.target: These settings can be used to control the functionality and security of your devices.

segment.source: You can create and deploy mobile device security policies for the following device types:
segment.target: You can create and deploy mobile device security policies for the following device types:

segment.source: Windows RT 8.1 and enrolled Windows 8.1 devices
segment.target: Windows RT 8.1 and enrolled Windows 8.1 devices

segment.source: Some settings are not applicable to some devices.
segment.target: Some settings are not applicable to some devices.

segment.source: See the table below for a full list of settings you can configure.
segment.target: See the table below for a full list of settings you can configure.

segment.source: Create a mobile device security policy
segment.target: Create a mobile device security policy

segment.source: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Policy > Add Policy.
segment.target: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Policy > Add Policy.

segment.source: Click Common Mobile Device Settings > Mobile Device Security.
segment.target: Click Common Mobile Device Settings > Mobile Device Security.

segment.source: Choose whether you want to create a policy that contains recommended settings, or whether you want to create a custom policy, and then click Create Policy.
segment.target: Choose whether you want to create a policy that contains recommended settings, or whether you want to create a custom policy, and then click Create Policy.

segment.source: Click the information icon next to each setting to view the recommended value for the setting.
segment.target: Click the information icon next to each setting to view the recommended value for the setting.

segment.source: For more information about how to create and deploy policies, see the Use policies to manage computers and mobile devices with Microsoft Intune topic.
segment.target: For more information about how to create and deploy policies, see the Use policies to manage computers and mobile devices with Microsoft Intune topic.

segment.source: See the Policy settings for mobile devices section in this topic for information about the settings you can configure.
segment.target: See the Policy settings for mobile devices section in this topic for information about the settings you can configure.

segment.source: When you are finished, click Save Policy.
segment.target: When you are finished, click Save Policy.

segment.source: The new policy displays in the Configuration Policies node of the Policy workspace.
segment.target: The new policy displays in the Configuration Policies node of the Policy workspace.

segment.source: Deploy a mobile device security policy
segment.target: Deploy a mobile device security policy

segment.source: Deploy the mobile device security policy to one or more groups of users or devices in your organization.
segment.target: Deploy the mobile device security policy to one or more groups of users or devices in your organization.

segment.source: For more information about how to deploy policies, see Use policies to manage computers and mobile devices with Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For more information about how to deploy policies, see Use policies to manage computers and mobile devices with Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: A status summary and alerts on the Overview page of the Policy workspace identify issues with the policy that require your attention.
segment.target: A status summary and alerts on the Overview page of the Policy workspace identify issues with the policy that require your attention.

segment.source: Additionally, a status summary appears in the Dashboard workspace.
segment.target: Additionally, a status summary appears in the Dashboard workspace.

segment.source: It might take up to 24 hours for status information to appear in the admin console.
segment.target: It might take up to 24 hours for status information to appear in the admin console.

segment.source: Require a password to unlock mobile devices
segment.target: Require a password to unlock mobile devices

segment.source: (specifies the type of password that will be required, such as numeric only, or alphanumeric)
segment.target: (specifies the type of password that will be required, such as numeric only, or alphanumeric)

segment.source: Required password type – Minimum number of character sets
segment.target: Required password type – Minimum number of character sets

segment.source: There are four character sets, lowercase letters, uppercase letters, numbers, and symbols.
segment.target: There are four character sets, lowercase letters, uppercase letters, numbers, and symbols.

segment.source: This setting specifies how many different character sets must be included in the password).
segment.target: This setting specifies how many different character sets must be included in the password).

segment.source: However, for iOS devices, this specifies the number of symbol characters must be included in the password)
segment.target: However, for iOS devices, this specifies the number of symbol characters must be included in the password)

segment.source: Number of repeated sign-in failures to allow before the device is wiped
segment.target: Number of repeated sign-in failures to allow before the device is wiped

segment.source: Minutes of inactivity before screen turns off 1
segment.target: Minutes of inactivity before screen turns off 1

segment.source: Remember password history – Prevent reuse of previous passwords
segment.target: Remember password history – Prevent reuse of previous passwords

segment.source: Minutes of inactivity before password is required
segment.target: Minutes of inactivity before password is required

segment.source: For iOS devices, when you configure the settings Minutes of inactivity before screen turns off and Minutes of inactivity before password is required, they are applied in sequence.
segment.target: For iOS devices, when you configure the settings Minutes of inactivity before screen turns off and Minutes of inactivity before password is required, they are applied in sequence.

segment.source: For example, if you set the value for both settings to 5 minutes, the screen will turn off automatically after 5 minutes, and the device will be locked after an additional 5 minutes.
segment.target: For example, if you set the value for both settings to 5 minutes, the screen will turn off automatically after 5 minutes, and the device will be locked after an additional 5 minutes.

segment.source: However, if the user turns off the screen manually, the second setting is immediately applied.
segment.target: However, if the user turns off the screen manually, the second setting is immediately applied.

segment.source: In the same example, after the user turns off the screen, the device will lock 5 minutes later.
segment.target: In the same example, after the user turns off the screen, the device will lock 5 minutes later.

segment.source: When you set deploy a password length policy to devices that run Windows RT, users will be forced to reset their password, even if their current password complies with the policy requirements.
segment.target: When you set deploy a password length policy to devices that run Windows RT, users will be forced to reset their password, even if their current password complies with the policy requirements.

segment.source: For Windows Phone 8 devices, you must set this to Yes.
segment.target: For Windows Phone 8 devices, you must set this to Yes.

segment.source: To enable encryption on iOS devices, enable the setting Require a password to unlock mobile devices.
segment.target: To enable encryption on iOS devices, enable the setting Require a password to unlock mobile devices.

segment.source: Applies to devices that are managed by Exchange ActiveSync also.
segment.target: Applies to devices that are managed by Exchange ActiveSync also.

segment.source: n/a (apps and associated data are automatically encrypted)
segment.target: n/a (apps and associated data are automatically encrypted)

segment.source: Additional information for devices that run Windows 8.1
segment.target: Additional information for devices that run Windows 8.1

segment.source: To enforce encryption on devices that run Windows 8.1, you must install the December 2014 MDM client update for Windows on each device.
segment.target: To enforce encryption on devices that run Windows 8.1, you must install the December 2014 MDM client update for Windows on each device.

segment.source: If you enable this setting for Windows 8.1 devices, all users of the device must have a Microsoft Account.
segment.target: If you enable this setting for Windows 8.1 devices, all users of the device must have a Microsoft Account.

segment.source: For encryption to work, the device must meet the Microsoft InstantGo hardware certification requirements.
segment.target: For encryption to work, the device must meet the Microsoft InstantGo hardware certification requirements.

segment.source: When you enforce encryption on a device, the recovery key is only accessible from the users Microsoft Account, accessed from their OneDrive account.
segment.target: When you enforce encryption on a device, the recovery key is only accessible from the users Microsoft Account, accessed from their OneDrive account.

segment.source: You cannot recover this key on behalf of a user.
segment.target: You cannot recover this key on behalf of a user.

segment.source: Require automatic updates – Minimum classification of updates to install automatically
segment.target: Require automatic updates – Minimum classification of updates to install automatically

segment.source: Choose the classification of updates that will be installed automatically:
segment.target: Choose the classification of updates that will be installed automatically:

segment.source: Important – Installs all updates classified as important.
segment.target: Important – Installs all updates classified as important.

segment.source: Recommended – Installs all updates classified as important or recommended.
segment.target: Recommended – Installs all updates classified as important or recommended.

segment.source: Allow control center in lock screen
segment.target: Allow control center in lock screen

segment.source: Allow notification view in lock screen
segment.target: Allow notification view in lock screen

segment.source: Allow today view in lock screen
segment.target: Allow today view in lock screen

segment.source: Allow personal wallet software while locked
segment.target: Allow personal wallet software while locked

segment.source: To enforce encryption on devices that run Windows 8.1, you must install the December 2014 MDM client update for Windows on each device.
segment.target: To enforce encryption on devices that run Windows 8.1, you must install the December 2014 MDM client update for Windows on each device.

segment.source: Allow Photo Stream sync to iCloud
segment.target: Allow Photo Stream sync to iCloud

segment.source: (sets the URL of the work folder to allow documents to be synchronized across devices)
segment.target: (sets the URL of the work folder to allow documents to be synchronized across devices)

segment.source: Allow users to download email attachments 1
segment.target: Allow users to download email attachments 1

segment.source: Email synchronization period Applies to devices that are managed by Exchange ActiveSync also.
segment.target: Email synchronization period Applies to devices that are managed by Exchange ActiveSync also.

segment.source: Allow mobile devices that don’t fully support these settings to synchronize with Exchange (Exchange ActiveSync) Applies to devices that are managed by Exchange ActiveSync also.
segment.target: Allow mobile devices that don’t fully support these settings to synchronize with Exchange (Exchange ActiveSync) Applies to devices that are managed by Exchange ActiveSync also.

segment.source: Make Microsoft account optional in Windows Mail application
segment.target: Make Microsoft account optional in Windows Mail application

segment.source: Allow intranet site for single word entry
segment.target: Allow intranet site for single word entry

segment.source: (allows use of a single word to direct Internet Explorer to a web site, such as ‘Bing’)
segment.target: (allows use of a single word to direct Internet Explorer to a web site, such as ‘Bing’)

segment.source: Allow automatic detection of intranet network
segment.target: Allow automatic detection of intranet network

segment.source: Require a password to access application store
segment.target: Require a password to access application store

segment.source: Allow managed documents in other unmanaged apps
segment.target: Allow managed documents in other unmanaged apps

segment.source: Allow unmanaged documents in other managed apps
segment.target: Allow unmanaged documents in other managed apps

segment.source: Allow adult content in media store
segment.target: Allow adult content in media store

segment.source: Allow automatic connection to free Wi-Fi hotspots
segment.target: Allow automatic connection to free Wi-Fi hotspots

segment.source: (send information about Wi-Fi connections to help discover nearby connections)
segment.target: (send information about Wi-Fi connections to help discover nearby connections)

segment.source: (allows the device to utilize location information)
segment.target: (allows the device to utilize location information)

segment.source: (allows operations that use near field communication)
segment.target: (allows operations that use near field communication)

segment.source: Allow power off If disabled, the setting Number of repeated sign in failures to allow before the device is wiped for Samsung KNOX devices does not function.
segment.target: Allow power off If disabled, the setting Number of repeated sign in failures to allow before the device is wiped for Samsung KNOX devices does not function.

segment.source: Allow voice assistant while device is locked
segment.target: Allow voice assistant while device is locked

segment.target: Use policies to manage computers and mobile devices with Microsoft Intune
